        @mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <span class="line"><!---->@mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <!----></span><br><br>The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <span class="line"><!---->The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <!----></span><br><br>CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<span class="line"><!---->CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        tommycli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 31 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->tommycli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 31 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>in this function [1] when window_num > windows.size() it will cause heap overflow.<span class="line"><!---->in this function [1] when window_num &gt; windows.size() it will cause heap overflow.<!----></span><br>It seems that the function can be trigger in webui.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the function can be trigger in webui.<!----></span><br>so I make a poc<span class="line"><!---->so I make a poc<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> out/asan/Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium         by

        @mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <span class="line"><!---->@mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <!----></span><br><br>The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <span class="line"><!---->The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <!----></span><br><br>CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<span class="line"><!---->CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Actually as I'm re-reading the repro instructions in <span class="line"><!---->Actually as I'm re-reading the repro instructions in <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> it's not obvious to me that exploitation can occur from web content, so I'm downgrading to Medium due to multiple mitigating factors.<span class="line"><!----> it's not obvious to me that exploitation can occur from web content, so I'm downgrading to Medium due to multiple mitigating factors.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8449e3cc217ed4b7fa95be8cb20508e367aba71d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8449e3cc217ed4b7fa95be8cb20508e367aba71d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8449e3cc217ed4b7fa95be8cb20508e367aba71d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8449e3cc217ed4b7fa95be8cb20508e367aba71d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8449e3cc217ed4b7fa95be8cb20508e367aba71d"><!---->8449e3cc217ed4b7fa95be8cb20508e367aba71d<!----></a><br>Author: Tommy C. Li <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tommy C. Li &lt;<!----></span>tommycli@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tommycli@chromium.org"><!---->tommycli@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri May 19 22:50:50 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri May 19 22:50:50 2023<!----></span><br><br>[history] Fix regression in Open All for History Tabs from Other Devices<span class="line"><!---->[history] Fix regression in Open All for History Tabs from Other Devices<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, I fix a security issue, but caused a functionality<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, I fix a security issue, but caused a functionality<!----></span><br>regression:<span class="line"><!---->regression:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4226314<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4226314"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4226314<!----></a><br><br>This CL keeps the security fix, but restores the functionality.<span class="line"><!---->This CL keeps the security fix, but restores the functionality.<!----></span><br><br>It turns out the `window_num` argument wasn't used at all anyways.<span class="line"><!---->It turns out the `window_num` argument wasn't used at all anyways.<!----></span><br><br>When opening a single tab: It was ignored.<span class="line"><!---->When opening a single tab: It was ignored.<!----></span><br>When opening all tabs: The argument never existed, so it was always -1.<span class="line"><!---->When opening all tabs: The argument never existed, so it was always -1.<!----></span><br><br>This CL just deletes the argument everywhere, and also fixes the<span class="line"><!---->This CL just deletes the argument everywhere, and also fixes the<!----></span><br>functionality.<span class="line"><!---->functionality.<!----></span><br><br>I manually tested it.<span class="line"><!---->I manually tested it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug:         I agree the function isn't written well and if you are able to call it with arbitrary parameters you could trigger an out-of-bounds memory access, but if there isn't a code path that actually calls it with the wrong parameters this isn't a security bug.<span class="line"><!---->I agree the function isn't written well and if you are able to call it with arbitrary parameters you could trigger an out-of-bounds memory access, but if there isn't a code path that actually calls it with the wrong parameters this isn't a security bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I found a way to trigger it without the patch.<span class="line"><!---->I found a way to trigger it without the patch.<!----></span><br>you need to login chrome, and have anathor devices.<span class="line"><!---->you need to login chrome, and have anathor devices.<!----></span><br>open "chrome://history/syncedTabs" and your page should be similar as  the content of poc.png. <span class="line"><!---->open "chrome://history/syncedTabs" and your page should be similar as  the content of poc.png. <!----></span><br>you can open the devtools and execute ```chrome.send("openForeignSession",["the_session_key_string","2000","-3000",4.4,true,true,true,true]);```<span class="line"><!---->you can open the devtools and execute ```chrome.send("openForeignSession",["the_session_key_string","2000","-3000",4.4,true,true,true,true]);```<!----></span><br><br>I guess that the_session_key_string maybe from the device name and use function to hash it.<span class="line"><!---->I guess that the_session_key_string maybe from the device name and use function to hash it.<!----></span><br>So if someone know the hash, it maybe cause the browser out-of-bounds memory access.<span class="line"><!---->So if someone know the hash, it maybe cause the browser out-of-bounds memory access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <span class="line"><!---->@mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <!----></span><br><br>The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <span class="line"><!---->The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <!----></span><br><br>CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<span class="line"><!---->CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        ```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void ForeignSessionHandler::OpenForeignSessionWindows(<span class="line"><!---->void         The affected function `void ForeignSessionHandler::OpenForeignSessionWindows` is covered by `chrome/browser/ui/webui/history/OWNERS` which points to `chrome/browser/resources/history/OWNERS` which lists:<span class="line"><!---->The affected function `void ForeignSessionHandler::OpenForeignSessionWindows` is covered by `chrome/browser/ui/webui/history/OWNERS` which points to `chrome/browser/resources/history/OWNERS` which lists:<!----></span><br>mahmadi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mahmadi@chromium.org"><!---->mahmadi@chromium.org<!----></a><br>manukh@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/manukh@chromium.org"><!---->manukh@chromium.org<!----></a><br>tommycli@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tommycli@chromium.org"><!---->tommycli@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>Are you aware of a better owner for this?<span class="line"><!---->Are you aware of a better owner for this?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <span class="line"><!---->@mahmadi, sorry to ask, but we need your help to route this report to an appropriate owner. If OWNERS no longer reflects the state of play, it would be great if one outcome from this report is an update to OWNERS. <!----></span><br><br>The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <span class="line"><!---->The POC is on macOS and I'm not super familiar with our process model on Mac, but my reading of the stack trace is indicates this is memory corruption in the browser process. Reachability of memory corruption in the browser process from web content would warrant a Critical severity rating. However, per our severity guidelines I'm downgrading by 1 level to High due to the requirement for users to accurately perform multi-step maneuvers to reach the bug. If my reading of the stack trace is wrong, and this is a crash in a sandboxed process, then the severity should be further downgraded to Medium. <!----></span><br><br>CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<span class="line"><!---->CrOS is definitely impacted, but from the call tree of ForeignSessionHandler::RegisterMessage() [1] it seems to have broader impact across our supported OSs, so I'm adding our other supported platforms to be conservative. @owners, feel free to remove OSs if your investigation determines they are not impacted.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
